data.title: The best burgers in town
data.text: Great food and atmosphere, The food is amazing and the service was really good too, I highly recommend this place. They burgers and super.

data.title: Consistently good....
data.text: Been using Tipsy cow every month for the last 16 months and the food and service are consistently good - simple to understand, no hidden extras, wonderful choice of local brews - and its not expensive....and the food quality is always good...if you like burgers give it a go...

data.title: Best burger in Redmond
data.text: Get the Rockstar - it's amazing, beer battered bacon, fried eggs and more. Don't forget to get the onion rings and the adult milkshake. :) Or the Brewmaster with onion rings and more.

data.title: Great burger in town
data.text:
We went to Tipsy Cow for a lunch with no special expectations. However the lamb burger we had there was just fantastic. The taste was very special and the portion was just of right size. We didn't feel too full and tired afterwards.

They have pretty impressive beers assortment. Mostly local beers and some of them are rare to find in other places. We've got two tasters each and all 4 beers were great 

Overall, great place and definitely, we will be back :-)

data.title: Noisy, family fun
data.text: On a recent afternoon we stopped by for a late lunch. The restaurant was filled with young families and the noise level was reflective of that! But, the cheerful and efficient staff made the experience a pleasurable one. The menu consists of about a dozen different type of burgers ranging from the traditional beef to an ahi burger (?!). Our table of four settled on traditional burgers with varied toppings. And the add-ons - we couldn't control ourselves...avocado, deep fried bacon (that was a little much...), carmelized onions, pickles...pretty much anything you could dream of. And fries could be substituted with onion rings, sweet potato fries, and the like. The meat was cooked to perfection and juicy, the bibb lettuce was fresh and crisp. The plentiful fries were slightly over-salted for our tastes and were embellished with a few too many herbs. But the onion rings, four thick slabs, were delightful with a very crisp coating of batter. Not one of us came close to finishing our meals - I would highly recommend splitting orders, particularly if you want to indulge in dessert or the extensive wine and beer selection. All in all, a fun stop on a Saturday...but avoid standing on the scale the next morning!

data.title: Beers and burgers
data.text: 31 taps mostly local brews great burgers and its the best place in Redmond to sneak out for a quick date night

data.title: Great value and lovely burgers
data.text: Been here quite a few times, the burgers are really good, the service casual and a good beer selection. Style is a bar with Burgers.

data.title: Fun atmosphere
data.text: I've eaten here a couple of times when in Redmond on business. The ahi burger is tasty and you can substitute the fries for onion rings or salads if you prefer. Sitting at the bar is great if you're on your own, nice relaxed atmosphere

data.title: Out of control awesomeness
data.text: If you like hamburgers at all, this is the place for you. Everything was delicious. Our waiter was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu and the burgers. The only thing I didn't like so much was the bacon appetizer - too much breading - I couldn't taste the bacon.

data.title: Always consistent (and DELICIOUS!)
data.text:
The burgers are on the pricier side, but you're definitely paying for GREAT quality.
I've had almost everything on the menu - you can't go wrong. Big, delicious patties; fresh ingredients; all natural / grass fed goodness!
The service is always on point as well. And don't forget the beers!!

data.title: Delicious burguers
data.text: I'd prefer these over Red Robin's hands down. The service is quite good and all burgers are gourmet (vegetarian options also available). If you want to be pleased, go with the Arsonist with bacon.

data.title: Great burgers and fries are good as well
data.text: I have been to the Redmond locations several times and to the Woodinvlle location two times.   The burgers are frst rate, but i recommend getting the ont on the top of th list.  The others are too big for me and I don't like to end up eating them with a fork and a knife.

data.title: Fun Place With Friends
data.text: It was fun being able to have a cocktail at a Burger bar!  The drinks were excellent and the food surprised me with how good it was.  Fun for a change, inexpensive and easily accessible!

data.title: Sadly a mixed experience
data.text: This was our first visit. I will start out saying that my wife loved her burger, her sweet potato fries, and her banana milk shake. My own experience was not that good. I ordered a spiked orange creamsicle shake, but got a regular one. My burger was ok, but the bun was huge, and the bread on the inside of the bun was cold. That made the burger experience pretty lame. The meat was pretty good, but the bun let it down. They serve the meals on aluminum trays lined with a sheet of parchment paper. It looks good when served, but is not very practical; the metal trays scoots all over the table if you try and eat the burger with you knife and fork, and the paper gets cut up and you end up eating small pieces of it. I may give it another try since my wife liked it so much, but I was honestly pretty disappointed.

data.title: Really Tasty Burger
data.text: I was here while in Redmond on business and sat at the bar for a quick solo dinner.  I ordered the Experience which was fantastic!  How can herbed chevre and portobello mushroom on a burger be bad?!?  Bartenders were friendly and helpful.  Would definitely come back!

data.title: Found the beef
data.text: This burger place is amazing. The burgers wonderful and the choice of fries is also great. Cannot wait to try it again

data.title: Great burguer
data.text: Great food, place is noisy but good to meet friends and the service is outstanding. I would recommend it. And we sure go back to try other burguers.

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: I had the rocks target and the pulled pork breaded things and both where absolutely delicious,  staff really nice and the place was quite full even for lunch,  a lot of colleagues had gone the night before and they all said it was great.

data.title: Damn Good Burger in Redmond
data.text: I took a small group from work over to TIpsy Cow... great burgers!  Quirky atmosphere, fun and great if you are a Seahawks fan. But the burgers are creative and delicious!  I had the Beast Mode Burger --- nice!  They serve you tons of french fries on a tray.... you can't eat it all!  Good service too!

data.title: Great burger
data.text:
Premium burgers that are messy, sloppy, two-fisted, deliciousness! The buns have a nice density that compliments the burger.

House made onion rings are an added bonus.
